abstracts.cdata!:
The Albania Water Supply Urgent
            Rehabilitation Project ratings are as follows:  Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is modest; Bank performance
            is overall satisfactory and Borrower performance is overall
            satisfactory.  Among the lessons learned are the following:
            (1) Participation of the four utilities and municipalities
            during the project implementation was key to design and
            execute the project investments in response to the local
            needs.  2) The frequent changes of the ministers in Ministry
            of Territorial Adjustment and Tourism (MOTAT) is becoming a
            chronic problem with continuous negative impact on
            maintaining continuity and commitment.  (3) Benchmarking
            developed as a pilot in this project was an innovative idea
            implemented for the first time in Albania's water
            sector, which allowed the local authorities and the project
            team to measure the project progress and impact on the
            ground.  (4) Working in good partnership with the government
            on this investment project has created a positive
            environment between the Government and the Bank, which
            helped address institutional issues at the sector and
            utility level during implementation of the Water Supply
            Urgent Rehabilitation Project (WSURP) and preparation of the
            Municipal Water and Wastewater Project (MWWP), such as:
            transformation of utilities into commercial entities,
            merging sewerage with water management, increasing water
            tariffs, and introducing for the first time the sewerage
            tariffs, which positively affected the increase of the
            billed revenues of four utilities, and the preparation for
            the upcoming management contract with a private operator.
